meanings.definition: A deep, guttural sound made in response to pain or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: The loud groan from the injured man echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: I heard a groan coming from the other side of the wall.
meanings.sent3: The groan of the old floorboards made it seem like the house was alive.
meanings.sent4: The groan of the engine signaled that the car was on its last legs.
meanings.sent5: The groan of the wind in the trees added to the eerie atmosphere of the forest.

meanings.definition: To make a deep, inarticulate sound in response to pain or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: She would groan every time she tried to stand up after sitting for too long.
meanings.sent2: The injured player groaned as he was helped off the field.
meanings.sent3: I groan every time I have to wake up early for school.
meanings.sent4: The old door groaned as it was opened, protesting the movement.
meanings.sent5: The dog would groan in contentment as it settled down for a nap.

meanings.definition: To utter a deep, inarticulate sound in response to pain or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: He would groan in agony as he tried to move his injured leg.
meanings.sent2: The patient groaned softly as the nurse adjusted the bandages.
meanings.sent3: The cat would groan dramatically whenever it didn't get its favorite treat.
meanings.sent4: The old chair groaned under the weight of the heavy man sitting on it.
meanings.sent5: The tree branches would groan in the wind, creating a haunting melody.
